thread.title: Michael Jackson's daughter tweets reaction to Joseph Fiennes casting
thread.title_full: Michael Jackson's daughter tweets reaction to Joseph Fiennes casting

author: Sam Haysom
title: Michael Jackson's daughter tweets reaction to Joseph Fiennes casting
text:
LONDON ‚Äî Michael Jackson's daughter has tweeted her anger over the decision to cast Joseph Fiennes as her father in the upcoming Sky Arts comedy Urban Myths .
SEE ALSO: Here's the first glimpse of Joseph Fiennes playing Michael Jackson 
The news that Fiennes would be playing the iconic singer caused controversy when it broke last year, and the release of the show's trailer has brought a fresh resurgence of criticism.
Boycott culturally insensitive #UrbanMyths & contact @SkyArts Director @PEdgarJones (philip.edgar-jones@sky.uk). J. ‚úäüèΩ #AngerIntoAction pic.twitter.com/cs5ClRaVl1 
‚Äî The MJCast (@TheMJCast) January 10, 2017 
On Wednesday, Michael Jackson podcast "The MJ Cast" tweeted at Paris-Michael Jackson to get her reaction to the casting decision.
@ParisJackson Thoughts on this portrayal of Michael? So many fans r sickened by it. Able to hit this original tweet up with a RT? J. https://t.co/mt2BNjdlo8 
‚Äî The MJCast (@TheMJCast) January 11, 2017 
Her three-tweet response made her feelings very clear.
@TheMJCast i'm so incredibly offended by it, as i'm sure plenty of people are as well, and it honestly makes me want to vomit.
‚Äî Paris-Michael K. J. (@ParisJackson) January 11, 2017 
@TheMJCast it angers me to see how obviously intentional it was for them to be this insulting, not just towards my father, but my godmother liz as well
‚Äî Paris-Michael K. J. (@ParisJackson) January 11, 2017 
@TheMJCast where is the respect? they worked through blood sweat and tears for ages to create such profound and remarkable legacies. shameful portrayal
‚Äî Paris-Michael K. J. (@ParisJackson) January 11, 2017 
Urban Myths , a four-part comedy series which includes the episode "Elizabeth, Michael and Marlon" ‚Äî a story based on a rumoured car trip Jackson took with Elizabeth Taylor and Marlon Brando in the early 2000s ‚Äî starts 19 January, 10pm GMT on Sky Arts.
  Sky Arts for comment.
